CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |
| PC71BM |
| di-PBI |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |
| PC71BM |
| di-PBI |

(Note: The paragraph mentions "low band - gap copolymers" and "high performance PSCs", but it is clear from context that PTATDPP and PTAFDPP are the specific copolymers being referred to. Therefore, they are considered valid material entities.)

We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

These entities are clearly referring to the properties or materials mentioned in the paragraph. The entities "highest occupying molecular orbital energy level" and "efficient charge transporting characteristics" are properties of the materials, while the rest are either properties or materials themselves. The entities "percentage of solar energy converted into electricity", "open circuit voltage", "short circuit current density", and "fill factor" are all properties of the polymer solar cells (PSCs). The entities "thienyl-substituted anthracene", "electron donating unit", "low band gap polymers", "high performance PSCs", "universal electron donor material", and "various electron acceptor materials" are not properties of the materials, but rather descriptions or categories. Therefore, they are not included in the table.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value                                       |
|----------------------------------------------------|
| The non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than PC71BM-based device with a value of ________. |
| PTATDPP and PTAFDPP have photovoltaic performance over ________. |
| PTATDPP and PTAFDPP have high crystallinity.          |
| PTATDPP and PTAFDPP exhibit PCEs as high as _______% and _______%, respectively, when fabricated with PC71BM. |
| PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of _______% when a non-fullerene acceptor (di-PBI) is used. |
| The copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band gap. |
| The copolymer composed of TA and DPP units has a low-lying HOMO energy level. |
| The TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure. |
| The TA unit has a weak electron-donating nature. |
| The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM have Voc values. |
| The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM have Jsc values. |
| The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM have FF values. |
| The PSC fabricated from PTATDPP with di-PBI has a PCE value of _______%. |

The values in the paragraph are:

1. lower PCE than PC71BM-based device: no specific value mentioned
2. photovoltaic performance over 4%
3. PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22%
4. promising PCE of 4.23%
5. relatively low band gap
6. low-lying HOMO energy level
7. Voc values
8. Jsc values
9. FF values
10. PCE value of 4.23% (when using di-PBI)
11. no specific value mentioned for the other properties.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                                       |
|----------------------------------------------------|
| The non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than PC71BM-based device. |
| PTATDPP and PTAFDPP have photovoltaic performance over 4%. |
| The copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band gap. |
| The copolymer composed of TA and DPP units has a low-lying HOMO energy level. |
| PTATDPP and PTAFDPP exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22%, respectively, when fabricated with PC71BM. |
| PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor (di-PBI) is used. |
| The PSC fabricated from PTATDPP with di-PBI has a PCE value of 4.23%. |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and have been removed:

1. The non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than PC71BM-based device. (This statement does not provide a specific value for the PCE of the non-fullerene PSC or the PC71BM-based device.)
2. PTATDPP and PTAFDPP have photovoltaic performance over 4%. (This statement does not provide specific values for the photovoltaic parameters Voc, Jsc, and FF.)
3. The copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band gap.
4. The copolymer composed of TA and DPP units has a low-lying HOMO energy level.
5. PTATDPP and PTAFDPP exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22%, respectively, when fabricated with PC71BM. (These values provide the PCEs for the PTATDPP and PTAFDPP when used with PC71BM as the electron acceptor.)
6. PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor (di-PBI) is used. (This statement provides the PCE value for the PTATDPP when used with di-PBI as the electron acceptor.)
7. The PSC fabricated from PTATDPP with di-PBI has a PCE value of 4.23%. (This statement provides the PCE value for the PTATDPP-based PSC when using di-PBI as the electron acceptor.)
